dict.acceptation: 发现，发觉；（剧情的）发展；被发现的事物；[法]显示证据；

sent.orig: He knows that he had made a real discovery.
sent.trans: 他知道他已经发现了一件真正的珍品。（make a real discovery 发现了一件真正的珍品）

sent.orig: Among them, discovery method (also called discovery learning or discovery teaching) is the typical one.
sent.trans: 发现法（又称发现学习或发现教学）就是其中的典型。

sent.orig: His discovery is no more an accident than any other discovery.
sent.trans: 他的发现与其它发现一样，都不是偶然的事。

sent.orig: He made another discovery of treasure-trove in the library.
sent.trans: 在莱利家仓库搞拳击的人则因他的缺席而高兴。

sent.orig: The discovery rate for wildcat wells in the Denver basin has changed radically with time.
sent.trans: 丹佛盆地的探井发现率随时间变化得很快。
